text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example: case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: # library(templateRpackage) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00 plot(pressure)

title: Subtract numeric values — resta
text: x Numeric vector y Numeric vector. Values subtract x warn.negative Logical Warn result negative

title: Subtract numeric values — resta
code: resta(2, 3) #> [1] -1 resta(c(2, 2), c(3, 3)) #> [1] -1 -1  if (FALSE) { resta(c(2, 2), c(3, 3), warn.negative = TRUE)  # gives warning }
